title: Issue with parsing arguments and/or environment variables
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `v1.13.1`
CL client & version: prysm@v4.0.8
OS & Version: Linux
Environment: Kubernetes v1.26 (GKE)

#### Expected behaviour

I'm trying to upgrade Geth **v1.12.0** to **v1.13.1** without any changes.
I expected well working Geth as usual.

#### Actual behaviour

Geth is running in a private Kubernetes cluster. It is exposed using a NAT gateway.
It is configured using CLI arguments (works with v1.12.0):
```
"--authrpc.addr=0.0.0.0"
"--authrpc.jwtsecret=/mnt/secret/jwt.hex"
"--authrpc.port=8551"
"--authrpc.vhosts=*"
"--datadir=/mnt/data"
"--datadir.ancient=/mnt/ancient"
"--discovery.port=7306"
"--http"
"--http.addr=0.0.0.0"
"--http.api=eth,net,web3,personal"
"--http.corsdomain=*"
"--http.port=8545"
"--http.vhosts=*"
"--log.format=json"
"--mainnet"
"--metrics"
"--metrics.addr=0.0.0.0"
"--metrics.expensive"
"--metrics.port=6060"
"--nat=extip:aa.bb.cc.dd"
"--port=7305"
"--syncmode=snap"
"--txlookuplimit=0"
"--ws"
"--ws.addr=0.0.0.0"
"--ws.api=eth,net,web3,personal"
"--ws.origins=*"
"--ws.port=8546"
```

After updating Docker image to **v1.13.1** I got:
```
Incorrect Usage: could not parse "tcp://10.0.0.201:6060" as int value from environment variable "GETH_PORT" for flag port: strconv.ParseInt: parsing "tcp://10.0.0.201:6060": invalid syntax
	
NAME:	
   geth - the go-ethereum command line interface	
	
USAGE:
   geth [global options] command [command options] [arguments...]

VERSION:
   1.13.1-stable-3f40e65c

COMMANDS:
   account                Manage account
   attach                 Start an interactive JavaScript environment (connect to node)
....
...
..
```
and Geth closes. Kubernetes restarts it and so on in a loop.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

I tried to run Docker image locally with v1.12.0, stop it, and re-run it with v1.13.1, but looks good. Geth is starting and trying to sync (I don't have synced data on my local computer).
I can't provide any scenario for reproducing.

> Incorrect Usage: could not parse "tcp://10.0.0.201:6060" as int value from environment variable "GETH_PORT" for flag port: strconv.ParseInt: parsing "tcp://10.0.0.201:6060": invalid syntax


Seems you have an environment of `GETH_PORT=tcp://10.0.0.201:6060`
As @jsvisa said, perhaps you can try to set `GETH_PORT ` as 6060?

I am seeing a similar issue.  Changing nothing but the geth version from 1.12.2 to 1.13.1, my helm chart ci testing is failing.  I do not have any env vars set, but suddenly GETH_PORT is getting set as ip:authrpc.port for some reason.  Here is a snippet from the logs.  Are we supposed to explicitly set GETH_PORT now with this release?  


@ojeffg seems this is the same issue. BTW, which helm chart are you using, maybe they set the default environment of `GETH_PORT`

> @ojeffg seems this is the same issue. BTW, which helm chart are you using, maybe they set the default environment of `GETH_PORT`

I found it, it's from https://github.com/RnodeC/helm-charts/actions/runs/6311602841/job/17135918464?pr=25

I don't know why helm/k8s/... will automatically set some environments.
